clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Risk of NSF Following MultiHance Injection in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Cohort Study Evaluating the Incidence of Nephrogenic Systemic Fibrosis in Patients With Stages 3 to 5 Chronic Kidney Disease Undergoing MRI With the Injection of MultiHance

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this long-term study is to prospectively compare the incidence of NSF in two cohorts (Cohort 1 - patients with moderate chronic kidney disease eGFR 30 to 59 and Cohort 2 - patients with severe chronic kidney disease or kidney failure eGFR <30).

primary_outcome.measure: To estimate and compare the incidence of NSF in the two cohorts defined for each cohort as the number of cases of NSF observed during the follow-up time period over the total number of eligible patients.

arm_group.description: Patients with moderate chronic kidney disease (stage 3, according to the classification of chronic kidney disease by the National Kidney Foundation, i.e., with eGFR comprised between 30 and 59 mL/min/1.73m2)

Patients with severe chronic kidney disease or kidney failure (stages 4 and 5, according to the classification of chronic kidney disease by the National Kidney Foundation, i.e., with eGFR stably below 30 mL/min/1.73m2)

study_pop.textblock:
A total of 1000 patients in 2 cohorts who are going to receive or have received MULTIHANCE during an MRI examination as part of their routine clinical management. The cohorts are defined as:
COHORT 1 - 600 patients of any age, with moderate CKD (stage 3, i.e., with eGFR stably comprised between 30 and 59 mL/min/1.73m2); COHORT 2 - 400 patients of any age, with severe CKD or kidney failure (stages 4 and 5, i.e., with eGFR below 30 mL/min/1.73m2).
